alert.note: Alert for Latimer; Pittsburg (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 24 at 12:57AM CDT until September 24 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHWESTERN LATIMER AND CENTRAL PITTSBURG COUNTIES... At 1257 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen according to radar estimates. Any ongoing flooding will be slow to subside as additional rainfall moves into the area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mcalester... Wilburton... Hartshorne... Krebs... Alderson... Mcalester Regional Airport... Robbers Cave State Park... Damon... Haileyville... Dow... Gowen... Bache... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
